page.title: 16POPULATION
page.content: In the civil parish of Morland there are 120 households with 260 adults of which 64 were retired leaving 198 under-sixties.. Of these 56 worked in the Penrith area and travelled each day by car:12 worked in the Appleby/kirby Thore area and 7 worked in the Shap/Kendal area. The remainder, 122, stayed in the village and worked either in their trades ie. shopkeeper,joiner, farmer etc. or worked from the village such as lorry drivers or stayed at home as housewives with perhaps a part time job at Survival Aids. So most of the working people in the parish work within it with a good proportion working in the Penrith area and commuting each day.
